retentioneering.visualization package¶

Submodules¶

retentioneering.visualization.funnel module¶

retentioneering.visualization.funnel.funnel_chart(values, phases, chart_title, labels=None, shuffle_colors=False, title_size=20, font_size=14)¶

Tool to create a nice funnel chart.

values - numbers (of users) labels - values displayed on chart phases - name of the step

– code source = https://plot.ly/python/funnel-charts/

retentioneering.visualization.plot module¶

retentioneering.visualization.plot.cluster_bar(data, clusters, target, plot_name=None, plot_cnt=None, metrics=None, **kwargs)¶
retentioneering.visualization.plot.cluster_event_dist(bars, event_col, cl1, sizes, crs, cl2=None, plot_name=None)¶
retentioneering.visualization.plot.cluster_heatmap(data, clusters, target, plot_name=None, **kwargs)¶

Visualizes features for users with heatmap

Parameters:
  • data – feature matrix
  • clusters – do nothing, need for compatibility with other cluster visualization methods
  • target – do nothing, need for compatibility with other cluster visualization methods
  • plot_name – name of plot to save
  • kwargs – do nothing, need for compatibility with other cluster visualization methods
Returns:

saves plot to experiments_folder
retentioneering.visualization.plot.cluster_pie(data, clusters, target, plot_name=None, plot_cnt=None, metrics=None, **kwargs)¶

Plots pie-charts of target distribution for different clusters

Parameters:
  • data – feature matrix
  • clusters – np.array of cluster ids
  • target – boolean vector, if True, then user have positive_target_event in trajectory
  • plot_name – name of plot to save
  • plot_cnt – number of clusters to plot
  • kwargs – width and height of plot
Returns:

saves plot to experiments_folder
retentioneering.visualization.plot.cluster_tsne(data, clusters, target, plot_name=None, **kwargs)¶

Plots TSNE projection of user stories and colors by founded clusters

Parameters:
  • data – feature matrix
  • clusters – np.array of cluster ids
  • target – do nothing, need for compatibility with other cluster visualization methods
  • plot_name – name of plot to save
  • kwargs – do nothing, needs for plot usage with other functions
Returns:

saves plot to experiments_folder
retentioneering.visualization.plot.graph(data, node_params=None, thresh=0.05, width=500, height=500, interactive=True, layout_dump=None, show_percent=True, plot_name=None, **kwargs)¶

Plots graph by its edgelist representation

Parameters:
  • data – graph in edgelist form
  • node_params –

    mapping describes which node should be highlighted by target or source type Node param should be represented in the following form ```{

    ’lost’: ‘bad_target’, ‘passed’: ‘nice_target’, ‘onboarding_welcome_screen’: ‘source’,

    }```

    If mapping is not given, it will be constracted from config

  • thresh – threshold for filtering low frequency edges
  • width – width of plot
  • height – height of plot
  • interactive – if True, then opens graph visualization in Jupyter Notebook IFrame
  • layout_dump – path to layout dump
  • show_percent – if True, then all edge weights are converted to percents
  • kwargs – do nothing, needs for plot.graph usage with other functions
Returns:

saves to experiments_folder webpage with js graph visualization
retentioneering.visualization.plot.step_matrix(diff, plot_name=None, title='', vmin=None, vmax=None, **kwargs)¶

Plots heatmap with distribution of events over event steps (ordering in the session by event time)

Parameters:
  • diff – table for heatmap visualization
  • plot_name – name of plot to save
  • kwargs – do nothing, needs for plot usage with other functions
Returns:

saves heatmap to experiments_folder
